result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Louis James was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per clerical error, correction the restitution percentage.

Defendant Kenneth Louis James in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Kenneth Louis James.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant ordered to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- 10 DAYS condition time with Huber for work and treatment, Court STAYED the condition time for use at the Agents discretion.
- No contact with DWL
- Anger Management Class or Batterers Intervention as may be determined appropriate by the Agent
- Restitution set at $1,074.00 by stipulation to be paid to DWL over the term of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Kenneth Louis James in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Louis James appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel requests projected plea/sentencing hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Kenneth Louis James not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Court waives defendant's appearance. 
Defense counsel is in receipt of discovery and offer and requests an adjournment to review offer with client. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
received and filed
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DWL.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kenneth Louis James in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Kenneth Louis James in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Louis James appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
